TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void RoutedEventHandler(object sender, RoutedEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed RoutedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub RoutedEventHandler(sender As Object, e As RoutedEventArgs)
public delegate void RoutedEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, RoutedEventArgs ^ e);
type RoutedEventHandler = delegate of obj * RoutedEventArgs -> unit

param.name: sender
param.span: 事件处理程序所附加到的对象。

span.span: The object where the event handler is attached.

summary.span: 表示将处理各种路由事件的方法，这些路由事件不包含除所有路由事件共有数据之外的其他特定事件数据。

span.span: Represents the method that will handle various routed events that do not have specific event data beyond the data that is common for all routed events.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 委托使用的任何路由事件的不会报告中的事件数据的特定于事件的信息。The delegate is used for any routed event that does not report event-specific information in the event data. 有许多这类路由的事件;突出显示的示例包括和。There are many such routed events; prominent examples include and . 编写为而不是一种通用的路由事件处理程序时最值得注意的区别[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件是`sender`的事件 （该处理程序是附加并调用其中的元素） 不能将视为必须是源事件。The most noteworthy difference between writing a handler for a routed event as opposed to a general [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event is that the `sender` of the event (the element where the handler is attached and invoked) cannot be considered to necessarily be the source of the event. 源被报告为事件数据中的属性 ()。The source is reported as a property in the event data (). 之间的差异`sender`和是路由到不同的元素，在遍历元素树路由事件的事件的结果。A difference between `sender` and is the result of the event being routed to different elements, during the traversal of the routed event through an element tree. 你可以使用`sender`或对象引用如果你特意不感兴趣的直接或浮升路由事件的路由行为，并且只想要处理路由事件在其第一次发生的位置的元素。You can use either `sender` or for an object reference if you are deliberately not interested in the routing behavior of a direct or bubbling routed event and you only intend to handle routed events on the elements where they are first raised. 在此情况下，`sender`和是相同的对象。In this circumstance, `sender` and are the same object. 如果你确实想要充分利用路由事件的固有功能，并相应地编写您的处理程序，编写事件处理程序时将使用的事件数据的两个最重要的属性是和。If you do intend to take advantage of the inherent features of routed events and write your handlers accordingly, the two most important properties of the event data that you will work with when writing event handlers are and . 对于某些输入事件的组合和[!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)]控件类，引发事件的元素不是有机会对其进行处理的第一个元素。For certain combinations of input events and [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] control classes, the element that raises the event is not the first element that has the opportunity to handle it. 如果输入的事件的预览版本的事件，然后元素树的根的第一次机会，可以设置到`true`共享的事件数据中，并且会影响如何将输入的事件报告给其事件路由中的其余元素。If the input event has a Preview version of the event, then the root of the element tree has first opportunity, can set to `true` in the shared event data, and can influence how the input event is reported to remaining elements in its event route. 按期望引发处理行为可以使特定路由的事件不是外观的预览。The Preview handling behavior can give the appearance that a particular routed event is not raised as expected. 有关详细信息，请参阅[预览事件](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/preview-events.md)并[输入概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md)。For more information, see [Preview Events](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/preview-events.md) and [Input Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md).
